Dr. Toast Live @ Burning Man: Relax-O-Matic Plushitorium

posted August 19, 2008 | music, shows

Wednesday, August 27, 2008 @ 6pm-ish: The camp with the unwieldy yet oh-so-apt name is hosting a toast-themed happy hour, and yours truly is providing the soundtrack! William tells me, "I have created a screen print of toast popping out of a toaster which we will apply onto peoples clothes, we will serve toast, give toasts and offer treats toasted in various ways." And Marty says, "We're in the midst of preparations and and we're all really psyched for the Wednesday happy hour. We've already starting spreading the word and we're thinking about starting your set around dusk, or maybe even a little earlier -- like somewhere in the 6pm - 9pm time frame. You can spin for however long you want, and then there will probably be another DJ coming on. We'll wrap things up and roll out into the night around 11 or 12. I don't really ever wear a watch out there so these are all rough time estimates."

Dr. Toast Live @ Burning Man: Mutopia

posted August 19, 2008 | music, shows

Friday, August 30, 2008 @ 8pm: The Flaming Lotus Girls have outdone themselves again this year and created "Mutopia" - a fiery garden of metal made of cast aluminium, steel, copper, flame, and light, featuring 13 independent seed pods with computer-controlled propane flame effects. On the Friday night before the man burns, the Girls will host a fireworks show in front of Mutopia (located at 4:30 and Esplanade), and Dr. Toast has the honor of providing the soundtrack! After the fireworks there will be an intermission to clear the debris, then an all-night party. (Photo: David Glasser)



Dr. Toast Live @ Concoction

posted August 12, 2008 | music, shows

Friday, August 15, 2008, 9pm - 3am - TMC Presents: CONCOCTION, featuring 3 floors of the finest entertainment, connection, & community in the city.... A night of the best "eclectronica" (midtempo, breaks, house & techno), world beats, and live music. Plus a plush chill space/salon & live interactive art. Requested Dresscode: Formal, Innovative, & Original. Featuring: Live music, DJs, live art, and a chill space/salon. Front Room: Mozaic (Nexus, Raindance), Alxndr (False Profit, DownLow), DJ Sean Bollin (www.sean-bollin.com), nex (Gratitude), Pym (www.iampym.com), DJ Damien (The Community). Upstairs: World Beats with DJ Felina (djfelina.com) & DJ Goyo & Live Music by Ian Rhett, Mokai, & Scott Simmons. Downstairs - Chill Space & Salon: Dr. Toast (False Profit), DJ Aquaman (Gratitude, Rhythm Society), Snow Leopard (Gratitude, Rhythm Society), DJ Fuzzmeister (Mystic Temple of Bliss, Afthonia, Openly). Decor by Fuzzy Philippe & Live Interactive Art by Ross Holzman & The Create Peace Project. Pair of tickets: $20 online / $30 door. All proceeds benefit the Men's Circle Fund.


From the Chairman of B.U.T.T.E.R.

posted July 17, 2008 | ask-dr-toast

Q: Thank you for your outstanding efforts to produce quality toast. You are an inspiration to all beings in the universe that appreciate the finer aspects of toast. We here at B.U.T.T.E.R. regard your presence as an indication that the cosmic collective consciousness is swinging towards equilibrium, and soon toast will be understood and appreciated for its universal relevance. Please keep up the good work and know that we will be watching for all future developments.

Thank You,

G. Blandston (_____@butter.net)
Chairman,
Bureau for Ultimate Tasting Toast Experimentation and Research

A: Dear Chairman Blandston,

And thank you for your kind and encouraging words. It's important and challenging work that we do here at the University of Toast, and even with my lofty and intimidating title of Doctor of Toastronomical Sciences, there is still so much left for me to learn about toast, and indeed about myself, before my work is complete. I am honored, and only a little bit creeped out, to know that you will continue to monitor my work in the future, and I look forward to the possibility of collaborating with your Bureau in its own endeavors, without any of those pesky restraining orders.

Warmest Regards,

Dr. Toast

World's Highest Popping Toaster

posted July 12, 2008 | toast-news, toasters

Did you know there is an official Guinness world record for "Highest Popping Toaster"? Well, meet the new record holder - the CO2 gas powered "Moaster". An account of the successful record-breaking attempt can be found at Digital Lifestyles. And while the folks at Guinness recorded the trajectory at just 8.5 feet, the video shows that it actually appears to go several stories higher than that.



Battlestar Galactica Toaster

posted July 12, 2008 | toasters

Here's one for all the sci-fi geeks out there - a toaster that sears the image of a Cylon into your toast! What a great way to start the day! Courtesy of the Sci Fi Channel.



Dr. Toast Live @ EVAC

posted July 3, 2008 | music, shows

Saturday, July 5th, 2008 - False Profit, LLC's annual Life Quality Enhancement product, Priceless, was scheduled for release in Belden this coming weekend but has been recalled due to uncontained pre-apocalyptic wildfire. Insiders at the company are reporting that Priceless is now set for release later this summer. In response, False Profit's Research and Development Brigade worked frantically for two days to develop a replacement product. False Profit’s first response to the statewide catastrophe, called EVAC!, is set to be unveiled at a warehouse location in San Francisco on Saturday, July 5th, 2008.



Dr. Toast Live @ Friends and Family 2008

posted July 2, 2008 | music, shows

Friday, July 25 through Sunday, July 27 - Dr. Toast plays a special set by the pond on Friday night at the 12th annual Friends and Family campout in Mendocino County, CA. Comfy chill space, firelight and more. Camp & Sons is a beautiful retreat, complete with a communal kitchen, a pond, orchards, three hot tubs (two of which are wood-fired), a well-maintained lawn area for lounging, beautiful gardens, outdoor showers, and much more. Hope to see you there!


Dr. Toast Live @ Priceless 2008

posted July 2, 2008 | music, shows

For the July 4th weekend, come join Dr. Toast on the beautiful Feather River in Belden, CA for the 3rd annual Priceless campout. Dr. Toast will be joined by such musical luminaries as Chris de Luca vs Phon.o, Tom Burbank, Vibesquad, Deru, and many others. Activities for the weekend will include a Dr. Seuss birthday party, merit badges, a flame tree workshop, hand percussion workshop, 4th of July bbq, free Sunday breakfast, and more! Additional info available at priceless.false-profit.com UPDATE: due to forest fires in California, Priceless is being rescheduled to September 26-28, 2008.

Texas-Shaped Toast on eBay

posted June 27, 2008 | toast-links, toast-news

Amy pointed me to this item on Valleywag: "A friend of an animator laid off from a recently imploded East Bay videogames startup writes to pimp the newly unemployed buddy's latest venture: selling toast on eBay. But not just any toast — it's toast that will be lovingly sculpted into the shape of each of America's 50 great states. First up? Texas. You laugh now, but you won't think it's such a terrible idea when the recession has you out on the street and your options underwater."
